title: How to Recover Deleted Files from Pen Drive in Linux

steps.title: Run "sudo apt-get install testdisk" at the prompt.
steps.content: Run "sudo apt-get install testdisk" at the prompt. This installs the testdisk tool.

steps.title: Connect the pen drive that you want to recover files from.
steps.content: Connect the pen drive that you want to recover files from. This will work for any USB drive.

steps.title: Type "sudo photorec" at the prompt.
steps.content: Type "sudo photorec" at the prompt. You'll need to enter your password when prompted.

steps.title: This selects the disk.
steps.content: This selects the disk. You'll then be prompted to choose a filesystem.

steps.title: After choosing the proper file system, choose Search at the bottom-left.
steps.content: After choosing the proper file system, choose Search at the bottom-left.

steps.title: You'll need to choose whether the drive was formatted with Windows or Linux.
steps.content: You'll need to choose whether the drive was formatted with Windows or Linux.

steps.title: You can choose Free or Whole to continue.
steps.content: You can choose Free or Whole to continue. Choose Whole to recover all files, not just those from unallocated space.

steps.title: Select a location to restore the files to.
steps.content: Select a location to restore the files to. Once selected, press the C key on the keyboard. This begins the recovery process and shows the status of recovered files.
